intro: Echinolobium caucasicum, commonly known as the Caucasian echinolobium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbrella-shaped clusters. Native to the Caucasus region, this plant thrives in temperate climates and well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland edges and rocky areas, where it contributes to local biodiversity. The plant's unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
